page.title: 19Changes in Melling - Part 2
page.content: Higher oil prices now make commuting more costly and less attractive, and recent years have seen an increase in retired couples to the village. Many houses are fetching higher prices and are increasingly for second homes or holiday lettings. Younger people cannot afford these prices and are compelled to move from the village.The re-shaping of farms with increased mechanisation means fewer employees committed to one farm and more self-employed "itinerant" workers within the area. With no shop or post-office few people walk through the village, there- fore casual social contact is rare resulting in very little "Village feeling." Responsibility for the village Institute, Parish and Parochial affairs, rests with a few active, concerned people. <Continued...
